meanings.definition: To reinterpret or reframe a myth in a contemporary context.
meanings.sent1: I will remythologize the ancient tale to make it more relatable to modern audiences.
meanings.sent2: Scholars often remythologize old stories to shed new light on their meanings.
meanings.sent3: Trying to remythologize a fairy tale into a sci-fi adventure might be a fun challenge.
meanings.sent4: She managed to remythologize the legend of the hero into a cautionary tale for children.
meanings.sent5: The artist's goal was to remythologize the folklore by incorporating urban legends.

meanings.definition: To restore or revive the mythological elements in a story or belief system.
meanings.sent1: The author's aim is to remythologize the forgotten gods in his new novel.
meanings.sent2: Cultural anthropologists often remythologize ancient rituals to understand their significance.
meanings.sent3: It would be interesting to remythologize a ghost story with elements of Greek mythology.
meanings.sent4: The storyteller's words had the power to remythologize the ancient legends in the listeners' minds.
meanings.sent5: The shaman's role was to remythologize the tribe's history through storytelling.
